problem_text:
In the notation of 21.52, let Aut_t(Γ) be the set of permutations τ ∈ S_D such that (a, b) ∼ (a^τ, b^τ) whenever |ab| = t for a, b ∈ D. Clearly, Aut(Γ) = ⋂_t Aut_t(Γ).
Is it true that for every finite simple group G we have Aut(Γ) = Aut_2(Γ) ∩ Aut_p(Γ), where {2, p} are the two minimal prime divisors of |G|?
I. B. Gorshkov
